summary:
I am a native English teacher, living in Haarlem, Netherlands. I teach individuals and small groups, and lead discussion groups for English language learners.

I hold the equivalent of a ​BA in English and Spanish languages and literature and the equivalent of an MA in English and American literature, a TEFL diploma, a teaching certificate for higher education, a CEOPs International Child Protection certificate, and 20 years of experience teaching English to non-Anglophones.
 
My own experience with learning languages (7 to date) has been my greatest asset in my teaching career. I speak French and Spanish fluently, and am currently learning Dutch. I also studied Latin at university.

I tailor my lessons to the student's needs, paying attention to any difficulties they encounter with phonics, pronunciation, spelling, grammar, syntax, semantics and the second degree nuances of the language. 

I love teaching and seeing my students progress quickly, and above all enjoy having a good laugh while we're at it! 

I am all for engaging the senses and the different forms of intelligence by making use of games, songs, pop music, picture-drawing, literature, story-writing, figures of language, videos, jokes, riddles, sketches, role-play, movement, city walks, museum visits, oral presentations, projects, translation, internet-searches, quizzes, treasure hunts, maps, etc.
